reviewText: This 2 DVD documentary is ok, I suppose.  If one is determined to sit through about 3 hours of saying the same thing over and over again.  I have been diligent in recent years in reading all sorts of news sites.  I do enjoy WND as they are usually "right winged"  if you want to slot them in somewhere.  I don't like the ultra left nor the ultra right.  I just like the truth without it being tainted by too much leaning one way or the other.  This film seems to be leaning way too much Right.  It gets worse as it goes on and on.  Disinformation is a tale about how people around the world since reporting news began, it seems, have been fed propaganda (disinformation) from day one.  Much of the information in the first DVD happened before I was born (I'm 69), and was interesting enough, but went entirely too fast to keep up with the history of it all and impossible for me to cross reference anything.  I have no doubt that Communism has been trying to destroy the West for a 100 years or more.  I think it was  Nikita Sergeyevich Khrushchev who spoke the words similar to taking the USA from within.  This was back in the 50s or 60s. Maybe I remember my mother saying it, or maybe I remember me hearing it on tv...But I've always suspected it to be true.  This became more interesting to me when they started to play events during Kennedy's office, and their significance in the attempts to capture America.Yes, they haven't quit, but I wonder who will win the USA first, the Communists or the Islamists. Apparently they are both fighting to win the prize...America.  Wish people would listen up.

reviewText: This DVD demonstrates how Marxism was and is so much more than just an economic system.  It includes a strategy to undermine the foundations of Western society.  The tactic it employs to accomplish this is to spread disinformation via schools, the press, and entertainment.  This documentary reveals how these tools have now been adopted by the Muslim Brotherhood and other radical Islamic groups to accomplish the same end.
summary: Great overview of the lasting effects of Moscow's ideological warfare.

reviewText: This book shows that evil takes many a form, even in our secular age.  Mixing generalities about the craft of dis/information with few facts and plenty of fiction, Disinformation: The Secret Strategy to Destroy the West is, upon some fact checking, a crass-act of disinformation, regarding the role of the Romanian secret service since 1963, and respectively libelous, especially in its final chapter where the character of Larry Watts, a long term American scholar and public servant, is attacked.A few Google searches will help you clear away the fog of Disinformation behind which stand Messrs. Pacepa & Rychlak.  Following is the summary of my fact checking:1) For the most years of the Cold War, Socialist Romania had been one of the best friends, if not the best, the US/West had among the Soviet Bloc countries;2) The KGB and other Soviet Bloc secret services considered and treated Romania as a threat on the same level as the US, even though she was formally a socialist sister country;3) Pacepa admitted publicly that for the most time he had been employed by the Romanian secret service, he was receiving orders from the top echelon in KGB;4) Pacepa climbed through the ranks of the Romanian Securitate at a time when the personnel at his level was torturing prisoners of conscience (religious, political, etc.);5) After his 'defection' to the West, (first in West Germany, then the US), Pacepa was received with suspicion by the West German and the US intelligence communities;6) In mid-eighties, halfway into Ceausescu's paranoia years, Pacepa was re-purposed by the hawkish wing in the 2nd Reagan Administration, moment in which he started a long record of disinformation;7) After the fall of the Iron Curtain, Romania started again on the path of becoming a reliable partner of the West (NATO, the US, and the European Union) in a part of the world fraught with uncertainties.  In this long and arduous process, culminating with Romania's acceptance in NATO (2002) and the European Union (2007), Mr. Larry Watts assisted several Romanian administrations, on behalf of IREX, with the alignment process regarding ethnic minorities, intelligence services and military conversion.8) After 1989, the liberal democrat Romania has sided with the US in all its international initiatives, and Romanian brave soldiers still serve along with our uniformed men and women in Afghanistan.We have entered a time when telling friends from foes becomes imperative. An empowered Russia is getting increasingly assertive in the post-Soviet space, and its leverage is not restricted to oil and gas.  I leave it to the readers to connect the dots while recalling a sound guiding principle, CUI PRODEST?Tarnishing the reputation of a long term and reliable ally, and of a fellow American, should come as no surprise from Pacepa, once a mercenary of evil who's never recanted for his activity as employee of a Stalinist state repressive apparatus (read, torturer).However, I wonder what role professor Rychlak has been playing in this Disinformation, for an academic ought to have tried to contact his fellow academic Larry Watts, lest the whole thing becomes what it really is in its final chapter, a libelous attack.When I read Umberto Eco'sThe Prague Cemetery, I had thought that its main character, Simone Simonini has been relegated to some fictional past, for in this day and age of quasi-instantaneous fact-checking, our world cannot for long accommodate Simonini-like characters.  Yet, Pacepa is nothing less than today's Simonini, a mercenary who's alive and kicking in some DC leafy suburb, on the dime of the US Gov't and unsuspecting viewership.  Viewers beware!________________Addendum:  In case the reference to Simone Simonini is too... literary, here's another one, closer to us: Ahmed Chalabi, also a protegee of the neocons/Richard Perle, just like Mr. Pacepa.en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ahmed_Chalabi
summary: Disinformation it is! This time at the hands of Pacepa & Rychlak.
